required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Telomere Length in Human Polar Body and Telomere Length in Cumulus Cells: A Clinical Validation Study
clinical_study.official_title: Does the Telomere Length in First Human Polar Body Correlates With the Telomere Length in Cumulus Cells: A Clinical Validation Study

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate whether telomere length (TL) of the first Polar body (PB) correlates with TL in Cumulus cells (CC)

detailed_description.textblock:
With the present study we want to analyze, as a primary objective, whether telomere length (TL) in the first Polar Body (PB) correlates with TL in the corresponding Cumulus cells (CC). As a secondary objective, a possible correlation between TL in PBs and blastocyst TL and ploidy will be evaluated.
To our best knowledge, there are no studies evaluating TL in CC and TL in PBs of the corresponding oocyte. With the present prospective study, we sought to investigate whether there is a correlation between CC-TL and PB-TL. If a correlation exists, CC-TL assessment would serve as a valuable non-invasive technique to gain information about oocyte competence.

primary_outcome.measure: telomere length (TL) of the first Polar body (PB) and TL in Cumulus cells (CC)
primary_outcome.description: Correlation between telomere length (TL) of the first Polar body (PB) and TL in Cumulus cells (CC)

secondary_outcome.measure: To correlate TL between both polar bodies
secondary_outcome.description: If the MII fertilize after performing ICSI, polar body biopsy for the second PB will be performed

secondary_outcome.measure: To correlate TL in male WBC and TL in sperm
secondary_outcome.description: TL will be assess in leukocytes (male´s blood sample) and in the sperm (fresh ejaculate)

secondary_outcome.measure: To correlate TL in female WBC and TL in CC
secondary_outcome.description: TL will be assess in leukocytes (female´s blood sample) and in the cumulus cells (CC) from the retrieved oocytes.

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate a possible correlation between TL-CC and TL-TE
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between TL-CC and TL in trophectoderm biopsy performed in the developed blastocysts

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate a possible correlation between TL-CC and ploidy TE
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between TL-CC and PGT-A results in trophectoderm biopsy performed in the developed blastocysts

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate telomerase activity (TA) in CC and a possible correlation with CC-TL
secondary_outcome.description: Telomerase is a ribonucleoprotein complex responsible for de novo telomere synthesis and addition of telomeric repeats to existing telomeres

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate FSH/LH gene expression in CC
secondary_outcome.description: During the follicular phase LH whose receptors (LHR) are expressed in granulosa cells under the influence of FSH, plays an important role in the regulation of ovarian function and is essential to promote the growth of the dominant follicle, final oocyte maturation as well as ovulation induction

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate a possible correlation between ploidy in PBs and ploidy in TE biopsy
secondary_outcome.description: PGT-A in PB and PGT-A in TE biopsy
To validate that PB biopsy does not impair embryo development compared to their sibling embryos with no PB biopsied

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate TL in sperm + TL-PB and TL in TE
secondary_outcome.description: TL in sperm + TL-PB and TL in the resulting biopsied

arm_group.description: Five selected MII will undergo sequential polar biopsy; on day 0 [PB1] (36-42 hours post trigger injection) and if fertilization occurred on day 1 [PB2] (17-20 hours post ICSI). On day 5, 6 or 7, the resulting blastocyst will be biopsied.
MII will not go under polar body biopsy. On day 5, 6 or 7, the resulting blastocyst will be biopsied.

intervention.intervention_name: First polar body biopsy in MII oocytes
intervention.description: Since PBs are by-products of the meiotic division of the oocyte and are not required for fertilization and subsequent embryo development, they can be removed to assess exclusively maternal chromosomal information without harming the embryo integrity. As previously described, PB biopsy does not impact the morphokinetic parameters of the embryo development and can be safely applied without the risk of impairing the reproductive potential of the embryo.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- BMI 18- 30kg/m2
- Expected normo/high responders
- Normal female/male karyotype
- Antagonist protocol with agonist trigger.
- PGT-A: NGS in blastocysts
- Fresh autologous ejaculates (≥5 mill/ml)
- Primary and secondary infertility
- Only ICSI as insemination technique
Exclusion Criteria:
• PCOS patients according to International evidence-based guideline for the assessment and management of polycystic ovarian syndrome 2018.
